messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using Java and the JAX-RS (RESTEasy) with Netty as HTTP transport framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `src/main/java/com/datastax/mgmtapi/resources/v1/NodeOpsResources.java`, I found that `anonymous` is implemented to process HTTP requests to the path `/api/v1/ops/node/rebuild`. To determine the full path with the correct prefix and the acceptable HTTP methods, I found the necessary information in other files.

I'll provide you with the contents of all related files, and your task is to determine and output:

- The full HTTP request path for the endpoint, which must begin with a forward slash (/) and have path parameters wrapped in curly braces ({}).
- Whether all HTTP methods are acceptable, this will override the results for other HTTP methods.
- Whether the HEAD method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the POST method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the OPTIONS method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the TRACE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the GET method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PUT method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the DELETE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PATCH method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.

You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

message.content:
Full path
- /api/v1/ops/node/rebuild

All methods acceptable
- false

HTTP methods (based on the code)
- HEAD: false
- POST: true
- OPTIONS: false
- TRACE: false
- GET: false
- PUT: false
- DELETE: false
- PATCH: false

Explanation
- The class has @Path("/api/v1/ops/node") and the method has @Path("/rebuild"), so the combined resource path is /api/v1/ops/node/rebuild.
- The rebuild(...) method is annotated with @POST, so POST is explicitly accepted and implemented.
- No @GET, @HEAD, @OPTIONS, @TRACE, @PUT, @DELETE or @PATCH annotations appear for this path in the provided source, so those methods are not implemented according to the code. (Per the instruction, I did not assume any runtime-provided implicit methods such as HEAD/OPTIONS beyond what is declared in the source.)
